prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. 1. Create a new coordinate system with: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Sketch a rectangle on face_1: - Loop_1: - Line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.375] - Line_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.375], End Point = [0.0, 0.375] - Line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.375], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using scaling parameter sketch_scale = 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using euler angles and the translation vector defined by the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with: - extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.0375 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.0 - operation: NewBodyFeatureOperation Part 2: Construct a CAD model of a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center, positioned on a flat surface. 1. Create a new coordinate system with: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0175, 0.0225, 0.0375] 2. Sketch four circles on the respective faces as follows: - Face_1: - Loop_1: - Circle_1: Center = [0.015, 0.315], Radius = 0.015 - Face_2: - Loop_1: - Circle_1: Center = [0.02, 0.015], Radius = 0.015 - Face_3: - Loop_1: - Circle_1: Center = [0.695, 0.015], Radius = 0.015 - Face_4: - Loop_1: - Circle_1: Center = [0.695, 0.315], Radius = 0.015 3. Scale the 2D sketch using scaling parameter sketch_scale = 0.71. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using euler angles and the translation vector defined by the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal = 0.0 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal = 0.0375 - operation: CutFeatureOperation The final shape would be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole. Remember that the hole will extend through the height of the part.</description>
